Method Detail

initializePushManager

public static void initializePushManager(Context context,
                                         java.lang.String appId,
                                         java.lang.String projectId)
Init push manager with Pushwoosh App ID and Project ID for GCM. Use either this function or place the values in AndroidManifest.xml as per documentation.

Parameters:
context -
appId - Pushwoosh Application ID
projectId - ProjectID from Google GCM

getInstance

public static PushManager getInstance(Context context)

onStartup

public void onStartup(Context context)
               throws java.lang.Exception
Must be called after initialization on app start. Tracks app open for Pushwoosh stats. To register use registerForPushNotifications

Parameters:
context - current context
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - - push notifications are not available on the device, or prerequisites are not met

sendTagsFromBG

public static java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> sendTagsFromBG(Context context,
                                                                              java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> tags)
                                                                       throws PushWooshException
Send tags synchronously. WARNING! Be sure to call this method from working thread. If not, you will freeze UI or runtime exception on Android >= 3.0

Parameters:
tags - tags to send. Value can be String or Integer only - if not Exception will be thrown
Returns:
wrong tags. key is name of the tag
Throws:
PushWooshException

scheduleLocalNotification

public static void scheduleLocalNotification(Context context,
                                             java.lang.String message,
                                             Bundle extras,
                                             int seconds)
Schedules a local notification with extras Extras parameters: title - message title, same as message parameter l - link to open when notification has been tapped b - banner URL to show in the notification instead of text u - user data i - identifier string of the image from the app to use as the icon in the notification ci - URL of the icon to use in the notification

Parameters:
context -
message - notification message
extras - notification extras parameters
seconds - delay (in seconds) until the message will be sent
